result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Clifford H Niemuth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Imp.Animal Shelter Space [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.14(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall comply with WI Stats 951.18(4)(c) for a period of 3 years which states defendant not to possess, own or train any animals, excluding current animals (3 dogs) and feral animals are not violation.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

judgments.dispoDesc:
1-year DPA. Conditions: 
- pay costs regarding Count 1 
- engage in no criminal conduct
- file written report of compliance monthly with DA office
- provide proof of compliance to DA office 
- possess no more than 3 dogs and no other animals, feral animals are not a violation
- noncompliance results in recommencement of prosecution 
- agreement can be terminated by either party in writing
- compliance results in counts 2 - 45 dismissed with prejudice
- recommencement of prosecution resumes if State learns of misrepresentations or pre-existing factors
- bail/bond remains in effect

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Clifford H Niemuth

defendant.name: Niemuth, Clifford H
defendant.address: E6460 State Highway 54, New London, WI 54961

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: C: Defendant

No parties present. 
All counts subject to the DPA are dismissed.

Defendant Clifford H Niemuth not in court. 
Danuta E. Kurczewski appeared for  State of Wisconsin. 
Statements by ADA as to the DPA. 
Unpaid monetary amounts shall be reduced to civil judgment.
Review hearing on August 8, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
C: Defendant
C: Defendant
Elements

Defendant Clifford H Niemuth in court with attorney William George Weiland. 
James H Fassbender appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Per ADA Fassbender, have reached agreement. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters guilty plea to Count 1 of Amended Complaint. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders defendant to pay costs only regarding Count 1, and further comply with WI Stats 951.18(4)(c) for a period of 3 years which states defendant not to possess, own or train any animals, excluding current animals (3 dogs) and ferral animals are not violation. 
Court orders remaining counts are subject to DPA pre-plea and Court approves DPA to take effect. 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.

Assistant District Attorney James Fassbender: Present
Defendant: Nonappearance
Atty William Weiland, Present
Clifford Niemuth is hospitalized, per counsel.
Set for another STC by BR1
Status conference on August 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on May 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant: Present
Attorney William Weiland, Present
Counsel has received copies of amended complaint.
